decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
The external finishing materials shall match those used in the construction of the existing building and/or areas of hard surfacing. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance.

The development hereby approved shall only be used for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the site dwelling and shall at no time be occupied independently as a self-contained unit.Reason: To ensure that the outbuilding does not adversely affect the amenity of adjoining residential premises and that the premises are not used for unauthorised purposes.
description: Single storey rear extension,two-storey side extension with relocation of porch and extension to roof at side to form gable end with rear dormer, front and rear rooflights and new landscaping to front garden and creation of a shed at the rear, demolition of existing studio.
